SamPy.stis.STISCCDImagingFlats

SamPy.stis.STISCCDSpectroscopyFlatÂ¶

Creates STIS Spectroscopic pixel-to-pixel flat fields from RAW data. Uses spline fits after dust motes, bad pixels, etc. have been masked to fit and to remove the low frequency structure. The data are divided by each fit to normalize the data before it is combined and co-added with appropriate weighting of flux errors.

Both 50CCD and 52x2 data can be used. For 52x2 row fitting is not done currently due to emission lines in the lamp spectrum.

For more information see STIS ISR 1999-06 by Bohlin and TIR 2010 by Niemi.

requires:Python 2.5 or later (not 3.x compatible however)
requires:NumPy
requires:PyFITS
requires:SciPy
requires:matplotlib

TESTED: Python 2.5.4 NumPy 1.4.0.dev7576 SciPy PyFITS 2.2.2 matplotlib 1.0.svn

date:created on November 23, 2009
version:0.6

VERSION HISTORY: 0.1: testing version (SMN) 0.2: test release (SMN) 0.3: first full working version (SMN) 0.4: modified FITS output to comply with CDBS rules (SMN) 0.5: improved documentation (SMN) 0.6: fixed and imporved _badspot function (SMN)

author:Sami-Matias Niemi
organization:STScI
contact:niemi@stsci.edu
todo:For improved median filter, one could use scipy.ndimage.filters.median_filter
